p: Autofluorescence is observed in some plants ( e.g. Berberis vulgaris L. , Humulus lupulus L. , Matricaria chamomilla L., and Salvia officinalis L. [ 28]) and endogenous natural products [ 58– 61] in a range of wavelengths which can interfere with fluorescence-based assays. For instance, anthranilates, alkaloids, coumarins, and stilbenes fluoresce in the blue-violet range (~ 400–520 nm), flavones and flavonoids in the green-yellow range (~ 520–590 nm), polycyclic aromatic quinones, tannins and some alkaloids in the orange range (~ 635–590 nm), and chlorophyll, porphyrins and certain quinones fluoresce in the red-far red range (~ 590–700 nm) [ 59, 60].
